result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geoffrey L Rogers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Competency Review Hearing.   Court reviews doctor's report with the parties. Parteis do not challenge  the findings of the examiner's  report. 
Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  
Court adopts the finding of the examiner and orders: Proceedings Suspended. Defendant remains Committed to  DHS in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  
Court ordered matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Geoffrey L Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney who appeared in person.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and due to defendant staying mute, per State v. Garfoot, parties do not contest  Doctors Report dated 4/28/2022.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  Review hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Cover sheet for confidential records, Filed.
This matter is rescheduled to 5/2/22 at 9:30 for Review Hearing in Br 45.  mn

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Geoffrey L Rogers not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Court is in receipt of a letter from examining psychologist that the Doctor was unable to determine the defendant's competency as this time. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Court orders defendant to be transported FORTHWITH to a DHS facility to complete their competency examination by Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings, and ordered defendant examined by Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Geoffrey L Rogers not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant has 22CF1094 that is set for a return on doctor's report. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in the trial court.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Court ordered defendant to take any prescribed medications as prescribed.

Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Geoffrey L Rogers in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Geoffrey L Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
